definition:
Let $P$ and $Q$ be two forcing notions such that given any generic
subset $G$ of $P$ there is a generic subset $H$ of $Q$ with
$\mathfrak{M}[G]=\mathfrak{M}[H]$ and vice-versa. Then $P$ and $Q$ are
equivalent.

Since if $G\in\mathfrak{M}[H]$, $\tau[G]\in\mathfrak{M}$ for any
$P$-name $\tau$, it follows that if $G\in\mathfrak{M}[H]$ and
$H\in\mathfrak{M}[G]$ then $\mathfrak{M}[G]=\mathfrak{M}[H]$.
